body:
Enable logging (i.e. to syslog) actions a user takes in a spack environment. Especially:

- `spack load`
- `spack env activate`

### Rationale

We have a shared spack environment that our users use. It would be helpful to be aware of what packages are popular, and what are no longer needed.

### It would be extra nice (but not necessary) if...

... the contents/format of the message were configurable/template-able, and could include content from environment vars (eg. SLURM_JOB_ACCOUNT -- to not only track who was loading what, but for which project they were loading it).


### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack

`0.16.0-1918-f36370e7c9`

- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate

title: Log actions to syslog
